title: Automate CHIRP compatibility test
body:
We need a regression test that exercises loaner-firmware images with CHIRP after the whitelist change.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Add a CI job that builds the firmware and runs the CHIRP UV-K5 driver against a canned image
- [ ] Ensure the test checks that uploads/downloads succeed without unsupported firmware warnings
- [ ] Document how to run the test locally in BUILDING.md

## Notes
- Pull in the CHIRP driver from kk7ds/chirp after PR #1414 merges
- Consider using a mocked serial transport or prerecorded EEPROM image to avoid hardware dependencies

title: Start tracked firmware versioning
body:
## Summary
- read a VERSION file during build so the firmware exposes a stable release token
- document the workflow and seed the first version identifier

## Testing
- ./compile-with-docker.sh

closes #13

title: Show channel names on main screen
body:
## Summary
- force EEPROM init to pick MDF_NAME so the main screen always renders channel labels
- document the channel-name-only UI in the loaner README for volunteers

Closes #9

## Testing
- make -s
- ./compile-with-docker.sh
- hardware: flashed loaner unit, confirmed both VFO rows show channel names and never fall back to frequency readouts

title: Disable menu key and map keypad to fixed channels
body:
## Summary
- map keypad digits to the first ten MR channels and remove the legacy F-key layer
- bind the side keys to force VFO A/B selection so borrowers stay on the programmed pair
- ignore MENU key events so the radio never enters configuration menus
- document the flashing flow and split the build guide for clarity

Closes #4

## Testing
- hardware: flashed loaner unit, verified 0-9 recall channels, side keys pick VFOs, MENU ignored

title: chirp uploads not working
body: the firmware is not on the aproved list in chirp we need to get in in the aproved list

title: start versioning the firmware
body:
we need to start versioning the firmware after we get the main issues complete

that way users can know there running the latest version

title: Assign keypad digits and side keys to fixed channels
body:
## Summary
- map keypad digits directly to the first ten MR channels and remove legacy F-key functions
- add explicit actions to force VFO A/B selection and bind them to the side keys by default
- update README to document the keypad shortcuts and new side-button behaviour

## Testing
- ./compile-with-docker.sh (GCC 10.3.1, clean)
- Manual hardware test: verified number keys recall MR slots, top side key selects VFO A, bottom selects VFO B

closes #2

title: remove unnessary code
body: we need to clean up and strip down the repo to remove the features not needed

title: Document flashing flow and split build guide
body:
## Summary
- add a quickstart flashing walkthrough to the README and call out packed image usage
- move the detailed build instructions into a standalone BUILDING.md reference

## Testing
- not run (documentation only)

closes #6

title: need to set the display to only have channel names not freq
Rename firmware for loaner build
body:
## Summary
  - rename the build target, binaries, and UART banner so the loaner image is unmistakable
  - update helper scripts, docker wrappers, and ignore rules to track `loaner-firmware*.bin`
  - replace the README with instructions focused on the locked-down channel-only build

  ## Testing
  - ./compile-with-docker.sh

  Closes #5

title: Disable VFO access for loaner builds
body:
## Summary
  - force the EEPROM VFO flag off so loaner units stay channel-only
  - scrub any VFO/MR key assignments on boot
  - drop the VFO/MR side-function entry from the menu

  ## Testing
  - make (passes)

  Closes #1

title: rewrite readme to include better flashing information
body:
also need to move most of the compile / build documentation to another file

we want to release full firmware to be able to upload to the radios with the build work done for them

title: remove menu button
body: we need to disable the menu button as users do not need to enter the menu

title: strip features
body: we need to remove unneeded features from the code

title: reassign number keys to channels
body: we need to set the number keys to the channel numbers in memory

title: remove vfo
body: we need to remove the VFO capability's from the radio ... the radio should only work on dedicated preprogrammed chanels
